CatDescriptText: Mr. Charles Bell, steelworker, 602 Conklin Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 31, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the District Attorney's office and the courts are exerting all out efforts in prosecuting equal rights cases in which Negroes are the victims?"  Answer reads: "In some cases, there have been fair prosecution, while in others, the prosecution has not been all out."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles Bell, wearing dark cap, eyeglasses, and dark plaid coat, posed with pipe in mouth, in front of two toned wall
